attributes.action: Update the Equality Act to include medical information
attributes.additional_details: The aim is to prevent discrimination based on medical status, medical history, medical choices, health information, health status, health choices, and vaccination, medical intervention, and immunological status
attributes.background: Add medical and/or health information as a protected characteristic in the Equality Act 2010

rejection.details:
We're not exactly sure what you mean by "medical and/ or health information". Certain medical conditions are already protected under disability protections. For example, if you have cancer or if you are HIV positive. The definition of disabled is set out in section 6 of the Equality Act. You can find out more in this House of Commons Library briefing: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-9061

You could start a new petition explaining exactly what you'd like to happen. For example, we could accept a petition calling for a specific change to section 6 of the Act, or for discrimination on the basis of vaccine status to be made illegal.
